info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 1 at 3:37PM MDT until June 1 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Denver CO
info.description:
* WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of central and northeast Colorado, including the following counties, in central Colorado, northeastern Gilpin. In northeast Colorado, Boulder.
* WHEN...Until 530 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 336 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This may cause small stream flooding. Between 1.25 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen.
- This includes the following streams and drainages... Middle Boulder Creek, Silver Creek, South Boulder Creek, Ralston Creek, North Clear Creek, South Beaver Creek, Jenny Creek and Missouri Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding.
- Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rollinsville and Eldora.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause minor flooding of creeks and streams, roads and roadside culverts. The heavy rains could also trigger rock slides or debris flows in steep terrain.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON
